w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach more everyday routines
by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
I wake up (review from part 1), I
to school (review from part 1), I get dressed, I take a shower, I make the bed,
my backpack, I eat lunch, I play with my friends, I watch tv, I go to sleep
n of this lesson, students will be able to:
Become familiar with the prepositions in, at, before, during, after, from
sets of words in complete sentences
dressed, shower, backpack, lunch, play, watch, sleep
in, at, before, during, after, from, under

Introduce the concept of routines – things we do every day, at certain times and places
Explain that prepositions are little words and phrases that help us explain where, when,
and how we do an activity.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
wake up, get dressed, shower, backpack, lunch, play, watch, sleep,
in, at, before, during, after, from, under
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
